item.title: How To Uninstall tSQLt From SQL Server
item.description: If you've used the SQL unit testing framework tSQLt before you may have come across the need to uninstall it from a database. There are a couple of ways you could go about this, but we'll look at the quickest method.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bos

item.title: Parsing Image Metadata with C# and ImageSharp
item.description: Recently I've been using C# and ImageSharp to work with images in code. In this post we'll be taking a look at how we can read and write IPTC Metadata properties for a given image.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bos

item.title: Scraping HTML with Selenium and C#
item.description: In this post, we'll be going over how we can use Selenium WebDriver and C# to scrape HTML from websites. I recently started working on a personal project that I plan to use for gathering English Premier League player statistics for my fantasy team. I had a fun time getting Selenium set up and working so I thought I'd share.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bos

item.title: Introduction to SQL Indexes
item.description: For most of my career I've known the general purpose of an SQL (read S-Q-L) index, but I've never taken the time to dig a little deeper to understand more until recently. In this post we'll be taking a look at SQL indexes from a high level, as well as how they can be used effectively (and not so effectively) to impact the performance of SQL operations.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bos

item.title: How Podcasts Helped Me Grow as a Developer
item.description: Podcasts have become very popular over the years and you can almost guarantee that there is a podcast available for any of your personal interests. In this post, I'll describe how I believe podcasts have helped me grow as a developer. We'll also take a look at some of my favorite podcasts and discuss a little bit of what they're about and why I enjoy them so much.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bos

item.title: Asynchronous C#: Below the Surface
item.description: In my last two posts, we've covered C#'s async programming model and also using async/await for asynchronous execution. In the final post of this series on async programming in C#, we're going to take a look behind the scenes at all the work the compiler does for us to make code execute asynchronously. Let's dive in!
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bos

item.title: Using Async and Await in C#
item.description: Async and Await are important keywords in C#. In this post, we'll be looking into how we can use `async` and `await` to write asynchronous code in the same manner that we write synchronous code. For a higher-level look at asynchronous programming in C# check out my previous post where we discussed the Task-based Asynchronous Programming pattern and more!
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bos

item.title: Asynchronous Programming in C# - Part 1
item.description: Writing code is hard. Writing asynchronous code is even harder. Luckily C# provides us with the `async` and `await` keywords to make asynchronous programming a little easier. This is the first of a series of posts in which I'll be going over writing asynchronous code in C# as well as a bit into the internals of how it works under the hood.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bos

item.title: Creating Your Own Framework for Learning
item.description: As software engineers, we are constantly learning in order to grow and stay relevant. I've found that trying to learn something new without a plan is difficult. This is why I created a framework for learning, which is what I'll be covering in this post.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bos

item.title: Selenian. A Minimal Dark Theme for Visual Studio Code.
item.description: There are many great themes available for Visual Studio Code, but I'm definitely the type of person who enjoys tailoring my development environment to my specific needs. So I created my own theme called Selenian.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bos

item.title: Updating JSON Data in PostgreSQL
item.description: If you're storing JSON data in Postgres, you'll eventually need to update it. In this post, we'll talk about a couple of functions that can be used to update JSON data.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bos

item.title: EF Core and Client Evaluation
item.description: Entity Framework Core is an amazing tool for interacting with databases of all kinds, but it doesn't come without potential pitfalls that can impact performance if you're not careful.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bos

item.title: Querying JSON Data in PostgreSQL
item.description: Storing JSON provides flexibility, but can add complexity. Let's take a look at how we can store and query this data in PostgreSQL.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bos

item.title: Behind the Scenes of Making my Blog
item.description: The number of options for setting up a blog can be overwhelming. Let's take a look at what worked well for my goals and expectations.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bos

item.title: JWTs: A Peek Under the Hood
item.description: JWTs are used heavily in front and back end development. Let's open the hood to see how they're put together.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bos

item.title: Hello, World!
item.description: The proverbial "hello, world" blog post introducing myself to the interwebs.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bos
